title: Home Now
background: Coming home after being away for a long time, and the joy and relief that comes with it. It's about the way family can be a source of comfort and strength, and the hope that we can find our way back to them no matter what.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Sunrise paints the window pane a faded desert gold
Another day, a thousand miles, a story to be told
He traces lines on a photograph, the smiles of his wife and girl
A little family, a loving world, what matters more than pearls
The dust still clings to his boots and the silence to his mind
But a different kind of thunder is what he hopes to find

[Chorus]
Oh, the hum of his engine is a different kind of prayer
Counting down the minutes 'til the feeling fills the air
This highway rolls on, a river to the place he belongs
Back in their arms, where he's been all along
The stars above him are the same as the ones they see
And every mile is one step closer, 
back to family

[Verse 2]
He remembers the last goodbye, the tears they tried to hide
"Don't you worry, daddy," a brave little voice inside
He carried that hope like a compass, through the fire and the rain
A shield against the darkness, a cure for all the pain
The front door waiting, the porch light glowing bright
A beacon in the distance, a star in the lonely night

[Chorus]
Oh, the hum of his engine is a different kind of prayer
Counting down the minutes 'til the feeling fills the air
This highway rolls on, a river to the place he belongs
Back in their arms, where he's been all along
The stars above him are the same as the ones they see
And every mile is one step closer, 
back to family

[Bridge]
He's learned a lot out there, about strength and holding on
But the true meaning of courage is the love that's never gone
He fought for more than a country, he fought for this very day
To hold them both in his arms and wash the war away

[Guitar Solo]

[Chorus]
Oh, the hum of his engine is a different kind of prayer
The last few minutes, he can almost feel the air
This highway's ending, a river to the place he belongs
Back in their arms, where he's been all along
The stars above him, shining where he wants to be,
'Cause he's home now, he's finally home, 
with his family.

[Outro]
Home now... home.

title: Private Lake
background: The feeling of being a country girl and the joy of swimming in a lake. It's about the simple pleasures of life and the way nature can make us feel free and alive.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Sun's high, no clouds in sight
Got my old truck keys, feelin' just right
Dusty back roads leadin' down low
Where the cypress trees and the cattails grow
Got my cutoffs on and a faded tank top
Ready to lose track of every tickin' clock
Yeah, the city's buzzin' far away and gone
Just the sound of cicadas singin' their song

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm a country girl with the dirt on my feet
This cool lake water is my favorite treat
Just me and the fish and the dragonfly wings
Got my own little world of simple things
Jumpin' off the dock, makin' a big splash
Washing off the worries in a second flat
Yeah, I'm swimmin' in a lake, no cares at all
Answerin' the call of that sweet, water's call

[Verse 2]
Might find an old rope swing on a low hangin' limb
Goin' way up high, out on a whim
Let go and fly like a bird on the breeze
Fallin' into water with a sigh of ease
Feel the cool mud squishin' right between my toes
Nobody knows this place except for me, I suppose
Just a little slice of heaven, hidden from the world
Yeah, it's just a country lake and a country girl

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm a country girl with the dirt on my feet
This cool lake water is my favorite treat
Just me and the fish and the dragonfly wings
Got my own little world of simple things
Jumpin' off the dock, makin' a big splash
Washing off the worries in a second flat
Yeah, I'm swimmin' in a lake, no cares at all
Answerin' the call of that sweet, water's call

[Bridge]
Some folks like their oceans, big and blue
But a muddy bottom lake is what I'm used to
Some folks need a big old fancy pool
But this fresh water right here, it's the rule
Got a little bit of moss, a little bit of grit
And I wouldn't trade a single bit of it

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm a country girl with the dirt on my feet
This cool lake water is my favorite treat
Just me and the fish and the dragonfly wings
Got my own little world of simple things
Jumpin' off the dock, makin' a big splash
Washing off the worries in a second flat
Yeah, I'm swimmin' in a lake, no cares at all
Answerin' the call of that sweet, water's call

[Outro]
Yeah, swimmin' in a lake, no cares at all
Answerin' the call of that sweet, water's call
Just a country girl and a cool, clear lake.
Yeah.

title: Upon a Winding Trail
background: Being in nature and the sense of awe and wonder that comes with it. It's about the beauty of the world around us and the way it can make us feel small and insignificant, but also connected to something greater than ourselves.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Dust motes dancing in the sun, a whisper on the breeze
The world unfolds, a canvas spun from ancient rocks and trees
My boots find rhythm on the path, a steady, measured beat
A pilgrimage from aftermath, to something pure and sweet
The air is thin, the silence deep, a wild and endless blue
A promise that the mountains keep, for travelers like you

[Chorus]
Oh, the great landscapes, they call my name
A wild and waking fever, a sacred, burning flame
From jagged peaks to canyons wide, where eagles learn to soar
I leave the lonely world inside, to find a little more
The sun sinks low, a final gleam, on purple-shadowed stone
I’m living out a waking dream, and I’m no longer alone

[Verse 2]
A river carves a winding scar, a story through the land
Beneath the light of the morning star, I reach out with my hand
To touch the moss on granite walls, the cold and certain spray
As water leaps and dives and falls, and washes doubt away
The earth breathes in, the earth breathes out, in silent, slow accord
And answers every whispered doubt, with just one perfect word

[Chorus]
Oh, the great landscapes, they call my name
A wild and waking fever, a sacred, burning flame
From jagged peaks to canyons wide, where eagles learn to soar
I leave the lonely world inside, to find a little more
The sun sinks low, a final gleam, on purple-shadowed stone
I’m living out a waking dream, and I’m no longer alone

[Bridge]
The wind sings tales of olden times, of ice and fire and change
And echoes through the silent chimes, of mountains in their range
I am a guest within this space, a witness, small and frail
Just following the ancient trace, upon a winding trail

[Outro]
So walk with me, and feel the ground, beneath your weary feet
Where nothing can be lost or found, and everything's complete.

title: A Slow Blossoming Rose
background: The feeling of waking up to a beautiful morning and the hope that comes with it. It's about the way the world can feel fresh and new, even after all the struggles and hardships.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The sun, a slow-blossoming rose,
Paints the sky in hues of gold.
A whisper of the morning breeze,
A story waiting to unfold.
The world is sleeping, soft and deep,
But a new day's melody begins.
A silent promise it will keep,
Before the noise of living spins.

[Chorus]
This is the song the robins sing,
A vital hum to start the day.
The light that helps the flowers spring,
And wash the fading dark away.
It's the rhythm in the waking grass,
The dew that glistens on the leaves.
This is the morning, here at last,
The vibrant tune my soul believes.

[Verse 2]
The mountains stretch their sleepy arms,
The valley breathes a gentle sigh.
All of the world's forgotten charms,
Reflected in a butterfly.
The sleepy owl finds its dark nest,
The deer step softly, through the pines.
The earth has put its peace to test,
And now, a golden chorus shines.

[Chorus]
This is the song the robins sing,
A vital hum to start the day.
The light that helps the flowers spring,
And wash the fading dark away.
It's the rhythm in the waking grass,
The dew that glistens on the leaves.
This is the morning, here at last,
The vibrant tune my soul believes.

[Bridge]
The quiet notes of waking light,
A vital pulse, a steady beat.
Chasing away the lingering night,
Making the bitter mornings sweet.
It's more than sound, it's energy,
A breath of hope for all of us.
The simple song of being free,
A moment we can truly trust.

[Chorus]
This is the song the robins sing,
A vital hum to start the day.
The light that helps the flowers spring,
And wash the fading dark away.
It's the rhythm in the waking grass,
The dew that glistens on the leaves.
This is the morning, here at last,
The vibrant tune my soul believes.

[Outro]
Oh, the vibrant tune my soul believes.
The vital song the morning weaves.
The morning weaves...
My soul believes.

title: I Love School
background: The feeling of being a student and the love-hate relationship with school. It's about the struggles of trying to fit in, the pressure to succeed, and the desire to break free and be the rebel.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Alarm clock screams at 6 a.m.
Another day of this bad dream
Staring at the ceiling, dreading the sun
Wishin' this whole race was already run
Textbooks piled up, a tower of lies
Another lesson, my spirit dies
The bell rings out a mournful sound
Just wanna disappear, not to be found

[Chorus]
'Cause I love school, yeah I love school
Following every single rule
I love school, it's so cool
Just another cog in the machine, a perfect tool
I love school, yeah I love school
This educational torture is beautiful
I love school, it's so cool
Just another drop in the conformity pool

[Verse 2]
The teacher drones on, a monotone hum
'Bout quadratic equations and things to become
My mind is miles away, a million miles gone
Just doodlin' in my notebook 'til the break of dawn
They tell me this knowledge will set me free
But all I feel are shackles on me
Lunch break's a blur of plastic food
Misunderstood, nobody's in the mood

[Chorus]
'Cause I love school, yeah I love school
Following every single rule
I love school, it's so cool
Just another cog in the machine, a perfect tool
I love school, yeah I love school
This educational torture is beautiful
I love school, it's so cool
Just another drop in the conformity pool

[Bridge]
They say it's for my future, for my own good
But they don't see what's misunderstood
All the pressure, the stress, the endless tests
No time for real life, no time for rests
I just wanna break free, feel the open air
Tear up these papers, not a single care

[Guitar Solo]

[Chorus]
'Cause I love school, yeah I love school
Following every single rule
I love school, it's so cool
Just another cog in the machine, a perfect tool
I love school, yeah I love school
This educational torture is beautiful
I love school, it's so cool
Just another drop in the conformity pool

[Outro]
Yeah, I love school...
I love it so much...
Can't wait for summer...
I love school... yeah...
Fade to silence.

title: Disco Flashback
background: The feeling of nostalgia and joy that comes from remembering the disco era through the stories of my parents. It's about the way music can connect us to our past and make us feel like we're part of something bigger than ourselves.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Flashback to my childhood, a Saturday night
The speakers were thumping, the colors were bright
My mom in her jumpsuit, my dad with his grin
They'd glide 'cross the shag carpet, where do I begin?
They'd spin and they'd shimmer, lost in the sound
The whole living room was a discotheque playground

[Chorus]
'Cause my parents were the disco kings and queens
Living out their wildest, '70s dreams
Now I'm on the dance floor, the mirror ball glows
And I feel the rhythm from my head to my toes
This feeling's not new, it's a song I've always known
This magic I'm feeling is all on my own!

[Verse 2]
Saw old photographs, faded and worn
Of roller rink parties from the night they were born
They held on to something electric and free
And somehow, that feeling got passed down to me
I close my eyes now and the crowd melts away
I can almost see them, just dancing and swaying

[Chorus]
'Cause my parents were the disco kings and queens
Living out their wildest, '70s dreams
Now I'm on the dance floor, the mirror ball glows
And I feel the rhythm from my head to my toes
This feeling's not new, it's a song I've always known
This magic I'm feeling is all on my own!

[Bridge]
They told me the stories of Studio 54
Of staying out all night, and begging for more
The glitter, the glamour, the music so loud
Now I'm finding my place in this new, modern crowd
Yeah, the songs may be different, the year has moved on
But the soul of the music is just as strong

[Guitar solo with wah-wah pedal, high-hats shimmer]

[Chorus]
'Cause my parents were the disco kings and queens
Living out their wildest, '70s dreams
Now I'm on the dance floor, the mirror ball glows
And I feel the rhythm from my head to my toes
This feeling's not new, it's a song I've always known
This magic I'm feeling is all on my own!

[Outro]
Yeah, all on my own...
It's all on my own now...

title: Venezia
background: The city of Venice, with its canals, gondolas, and romantic atmosphere. It's about the beauty of the city and the way it can make you feel like you're in a dream. Visited it already five times, and it never gets old.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Walking down the cobblestone streets,
The sun begins to fade.
Reflections on the canals, so sweet,
A memory is made.

Venezia, you hold my heart in hand,
Lost in a waking dream.
On this beautiful, floating land,
A melody, a stream.

[Chorus]
Venezia, città d'amore,
I tuoi canali sono un tesoro.
Navigando sulle tue acque,
Il tempo si ferma per sempre.

Una gondola scivola, una melodia sussurrata,
Sotto la pallida luce della luna.
La tua magia riempie il pomeriggio,
Una sensazione che brucia intensamente.

[Verse 2]
Passi lenti, l'aria è fresca,
Soffia una brezza leggera.
Un segreto tra la maschera,
Sotto la sera.

Caffè illuminati da luce dorata,
Uno spritz con un amico.
La città risplende nella notte soave,
Una sensazione che non avrà fine.

[Chorus]
Venezia, città d'amore,
I tuoi canali sono un tesoro.
Navigando sulle tue acque,
Il tempo si ferma per sempre.

Una gondola scivola, una melodia sussurrata,
Sotto la pallida luce della luna.
La tua magia riempie il pomeriggio,
Una sensazione che brucia intensamente.

[Bridge]
The bridge of sighs, a timeless gaze,
A history of stories untold.
Lost in your mazelike haze,
A city of silver and gold.

Ponte dei Sospiri, non dimentico,
Il tuo fascino è così intenso.
In ogni angolo, un mistero,
Questo è il mio desiderio.

[Outro]
Non voglio partire mai.
Sotto il cielo di Venezia...
Siamo qui.

title: Forever
background: The feeling of being in love and wanting to spend forever with that person. It's about the joy and excitement of a new relationship, and the hope that it will last forever.
lyrics:
[Verse 1 - English]
The world outside is moving fast
A blur of lights from a life that's passed
But time stands still when you're with me
Lost in the quiet, just you and me.
Every word you say is a melody
A perfect rhythm, a sweet harmony.
I never knew my heart could feel this way
Until you came and brightened my day.

[Chorus - Italian]
E adesso so che sei il mio destino
Il mio unico, vero, grande amore.
Sei la luce che mi guida, il mio cammino
L'ancora che trattiene il mio cuore.
Non c'è niente che non farei per te
Per stare al tuo fianco, per sempre.

[Verse 2 - Italian]
Sento il calore del tuo respiro
Mentre ti tengo forte e non ti perdo.
Ogni tuo tocco è un desiderio
Un dolce brivido, un segreto.
Nei tuoi occhi trovo il mio cielo
Il posto perfetto, il mio rifugio.
Sei la risposta ad ogni mia preghiera
Il mio sole, la mia primavera.

[Bridge - English and Italian]
I never thought I'd find this kind of peace
Questo amore, questa verità.
My soul is finally at ease
La mia anima è libera, è solo per te.
I'll give you everything, my everything
Tutto di me, per sempre.

[Chorus - Italian]
E adesso so che sei il mio destino
Il mio unico, vero, grande amore.
Sei la luce che mi guida, il mio cammino
L'ancora che trattiene il mio cuore.
Non c'è niente che non farei per te
Per stare al tuo fianco, per sempre.

[Guitar Solo]

[Chorus - Italian]
E adesso so che sei il mio destino
Il mio unico, vero, grande amore.
Sei la luce che mi guida, il mio cammino
L'ancora che trattiene il mio cuore.
Non c'è niente che non farei per te
Per stare al tuo fianco, per sempre.

[Outro - Italian]
Sempre... per sempre...
Il mio amore...
Sei tu... solo tu...
Per sempre.

title: Sanctuary Riot
background: The feeling of rebellion and freedom that comes with breaking the rules and defying authority. It's about the thrill of standing up for what you believe in, even when it means going against the grain.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Stained glass shatters under the bass
Echoes ripping through the holy space
Candles flicker the shadows quake
Youth unleashed with no rules to break

[Chorus]
Hallelujah in distortion
Hands raised in rebellion’s motion
Sanctuary riot screams out loud
Sacred ground we’re breaking now

[Verse 2]
Wooden pews turned into a stage
Choir robes caught in the rage
Organ keys howling wild and free
Saints and sinners in harmony

[Prechorus]
What is holy what is real
What’s the fire we’re meant to feel

[Chorus]
Hallelujah in distortion
Hands raised in rebellion’s motion
Sanctuary riot screams out loud
Sacred ground we’re breaking now

[Bridge]
Do you hear it the hymn of defiance
Do you feel it the pulse of alliance
The cross sways like a pendulum
Judgment waits but here we come

[Guitar solo]

[Chorus]
Hallelujah in distortion
Hands raised in rebellion’s motion
Sanctuary riot screams out loud
Sacred ground we’re breaking now

title: Ghost in the Garden
background: About the fear of opening up to love again after being hurt in the past. It's about the struggle to let go of the pain and trust someone new, and the hope that maybe this time it will be different.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The coffee's cold, the sun is weak
Across the table, you don't speak
You just watch me with those eyes
That mirror all the clear blue skies
And a part of me wants to just fall in
Let your light erase where the dark has been
But the shadow of a former flame
Still whispers my most guarded name

[Pre-Chorus]
I trace the rim of this empty cup
Trying to find the strength to open up
'Cause I remember the fire, the beautiful blaze
That turned to ashes in those final days
And now my heart is a house with a lock
I only turn the key for a hesitant knock

[Chorus]
So forgive me if my hands are tight
If I pull away in the dead of night
This isn't you, it's the ghost in the garden
The one that bloomed and then begged for pardon
I'm standing at the edge, a shaky line
Afraid to believe this love is truly mine
'Cause the deepest cuts, they heal the wrong way
They teach you how to run, how to not stay

[Verse 2]
You talk about a future bright
Of open doors and endless light
You offer me a gentle hand
The safest place in a foreign land
But I keep one foot on the solid ground
Where no beautiful promises can be found
I've memorized the pattern of the break
I know the exact toll that love will take

[Pre-Chorus]
I trace the rim of this empty cup
Trying to find the strength to open up
'Cause I remember the thunder, the glorious sound
That left me broken, scattered on the ground
And now my heart is a house with a lock
I only turn the key for a hesitant knock

[Chorus]
So forgive me if my hands are tight
If I pull away in the dead of night
This isn't you, it's the ghost in the garden
The one that bloomed and then begged for pardon
I'm standing at the edge, a shaky line
Afraid to believe this love is truly mine
'Cause the deepest cuts, they heal the wrong way
They teach you how to run, how to not stay

[Bridge]
You ask me what I'm running from
I whisper back, "The next time it comes"
The moment my walls turn to sand
The moment I finally, truly understand
That I gave you my everything, and you stayed
But the blueprint for leaving has already been laid

[Guitar Solo - Slow, mournful, building to a quiet, desperate peak]

[Chorus]
So forgive me if my hands are tight
If I pull away in the dead of night
This isn't you, it's the ghost in the garden
The one that bloomed and then begged for pardon
I'm standing at the edge, a shaky line
Afraid to believe this love is truly mine
'Cause the deepest cuts, they heal the wrong way
They teach you how to run, how to not stay

[Outro]
Oh, I want to stay...
I want to stay...
But the door is open just a crack
And I'm too scared to turn my back.
Just a crack...

title: Deep Blue
background: The feeling of being underwater, and the sense of freedom and peace that comes with it. It's about the beauty of the ocean and the way it can make you feel like you're in a different world.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The world up above is a distant hum
A rush of demands, a race to become
But I leave the noise at the surface line
For a silent kingdom where I can shine
One single breath, a lungful of peace
A voluntary, beautiful release.

[Chorus]
Down to the blue where the sun can't reach
Minutes tick by like grains of sand on the beach
With just a bikini skin to the tide
The ocean's freedom nowhere to hide
Deep blue calling, a silent embrace
Holding my breath, finding my place.

[Verse 2]
The pressure is real, but it feels like a glove
Cradling my body with effortless love
I see the manta glide, the silver-scaled shoal
It takes more than a minute to nourish my soul
A liquid current, a weightless ballet
I could stay down here forever and pray.

[Chorus]
Down to the blue where the sun can't reach
Minutes tick by like grains of sand on the beach
With just a bikini skin to the tide
The ocean's freedom nowhere to hide
Deep blue calling, a silent embrace
Holding my breath, finding my place.

[Bridge]
My heart beats slow, a meditative drum
I've conquered the panic, the fear has become
A ripple of water that smooths and then flows
The deeper I travel, the truer it grows.

[Chorus]
Down to the blue where the sun can't reach
Minutes tick by like grains of sand on the beach
With just a bikini skin to the tide
The ocean's freedom nowhere to hide
Deep blue calling, a silent embrace
Holding my breath, finding my place.

[Outro]
Only the blue, only the sun's fading gleam
Living the impossible, living the dream
Up for the air, but the ocean's still mine
Until I return to that surface line.

title: Friday Night
background: A wild Friday night out with friends that starts off fun but quickly spirals into chaos. It's a humorous reflection on the unpredictable nature of nightlife and the consequences of letting loose.
lyrics:
Finally weekend. Whooo!

[Verse 1]
Six PM, the week is dead,
New dress on, nothing left unsaid.
Met my girls at the usual haunt,
Ready for the fun that we all want.
First Margarita, sweet and sharp,
Playing a game that leaves its mark.
Everything's smooth, the vibe is strong,
Where I belong, nothing is wrong.
Just a little buzz, a gentle high,
Watching the world drift by. (I am so cultured right now.)

[Chorus]
Oh, Friday night firestorm, starts with a spark,
Feelin' fearless, dancing right there in the dark.
Sippin' slow, keepin' the cool facade,
This is the moment, perfectly played and broad.
Just let it run, forget the strain,
Before the night turns into a hurricane.

[Verse 2]
Then the fourth, the fifth, the sixth are gone,
Suddenly, I don't know the dawn.
The room is tilting, the lights are a scream,
(Definitely not stable!)
I’m shouting at the DJ for a song he won't play,
Tried to climb the bar, fell in a strange way.
My wallet's gone, my jacket's lost,
Don't care about the final cost.
Kissed a random stranger right on the floor,
Then ran out the door and wanted more! (To the next adventure!)

[Chorus]
Oh, Friday night firestorm, burning so wild,
Feelin' reckless, acting like a crazy child.
Guzzling fast, losing all track of the time,
This is the moment, reaching the ultimate climb.
*Stop* the spinning, forget the noise,
Making all the most regrettable, loud choice.

[Bridge]
Stumbling down the street, shoe missing one heel, (Cinderella-style!)
Tried to ride a stranger's bicycle, how did that feel?
I'm laughing hysterically at the moon above, (He knows! He saw everything!)
Don't know my name, don't know who to love. (But I love this pavement!)
Banged on the wrong apartment door, yelling a friend's name, (Open up, it's me, the chaos!)
No control left, it’s a chaotic, burning flame.
Phone shattered screen, a taxi driver sighs,
Seeing the terror reflected in my own eyes.
Why did I push it this extreme?
Lost the night inside a waking dream. (Need a map back to reality.)

[Verse 3]
The front door is open, I barely recall the code,
Left a trail of damage down the whole dark road.
Tripped over the rug, landed with a thud,
Covered in something that might be mud.
Dragged myself along the cold, hard floor,
Didn't even bother to close the door.
The world goes black, the chaos dies,
Face-down on the mattress, with a painful surprise.
No memory of the final climb,
Just escaping the clutches of space and time. (Whew, made it!)

[Outro]
Yeah, the night went nuclear, completely unhinged, (That's a five-star review!)
But the bed's right here, finally unpinched.
Close my eyes, the throbbing slows,
'Til the next Friday, where the next storm grows.
Goodnight, and goodbye sanity. (See you next week!)

title: The Hard Way
background: This song is about the mistakes I made in a past relationship, and the regret I feel for not treating my partner better. It's a reflection on how I wish I could go back and do things differently, but also an acknowledgment that I had to learn the hard way.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I'd snap at the little things you did
Roll my eyes and make you feel like a kid
I'd cancel plans at the very last minute
'Cause something 'better' had to be in it
You'd bring me flowers, I'd leave 'em to wilt
My every action built on selfish guilt
You were a shelter, and I brought the storm
Took your gentle nature and kept it warm
Just for me to use and disregard

[Chorus]
Oh, I wish I could rewind, take every word back now
I finally see the fool I was, somehow
The mirrors here are cruel, they show a girl who's cold
And losing you is a story getting old
If I could trade this hollow space for one more kiss
I'd crawl back on my knees to beg for this
'Cause now the silence screams, and I hear your goodbye
I regret everything, baby, please come back and try.

[Verse 2]
I made you walk on eggshells every day
Felt like I earned the right to have my way
I talked down to you in front of our friends
Never thought that our story had ends
I'd pick a fight just to have you chase me
My validation was all I could see
You'd whisper sorry for what I had done
I thought the battle was easily won
But I didn't see the price I would pay

[Chorus]
Oh, I wish I could rewind, take every word back now
I finally see the fool I was, somehow
The mirrors here are cruel, they show a girl who's cold
And losing you is a story getting old
If I could trade this hollow space for one more kiss
I'd crawl back on my knees to beg for this
'Cause now the silence screams, and I hear your goodbye
I regret everything, baby, please come back and try.

[Bridge]
I kept pushing until the door finally closed
The beautiful thing that we had decomposed
I thought I was strong, but I was just unkind
Leaving your loyalty broken behind
Now I sit with the echoes of your sweet name
And the crushing weight of this self-inflicted shame

[Chorus]
Oh, I wish I could rewind, take every word back now
I finally see the fool I was, somehow
The mirrors here are cruel, they show a girl who's cold
And losing you is a story getting old
If I could trade this hollow space for one more kiss
I'd crawl back on my knees to beg for this
'Cause now the silence screams, and I hear your goodbye
I regret everything, baby, please come back and try.

[Outro]
Please come back and try...
Don't let our good love just die...
I learned the hard way...
Oh, I learned the hard way...

title: My Foundation
background: This song is a tribute to my mom (love you, mom!), who has been the foundation of my life. It's about the sacrifices she made and the love she gave to help me grow into the person I am today.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I used to think the world just *was*, no strings, no price to pay
I took the quiet comforts for granted every day
The scent of coffee brewing before the sun would rise
The perfect sweater waiting, a twinkle in your eyes
I never had to worry 'bout the darkness at the door
'Cause you were always standing there, and so much more.

[Pre-Chorus]
Now I'm finally standing tall, preparing for the flight
And suddenly I see it all, this steady, shining light.

[Chorus]
Oh, the sacrifices big and small, the ones I couldn’t see
You put your own dreams on a shelf just so you could raise me
You traded late-night freedom for scraped knees and lullabies
You fought the silent battles with grace and your disguise
A backbone made of steel, a tenderness you kept
You gave up everything you had so I could get some rest
You gave me roots, you gave me wings, you showed me how to grow
And everything I am today, Mom, is everything you sowed.

[Verse 2]
I remember the geometry that just wouldn't make sense
You stayed up late to figure it, a tireless defense
The perfect birthday parties, the costumes sewn by hand
The way you taught me kindness in a world that didn't understand
You told me it’s okay to cry, and you meant it when you said
Your heart's the only compass, echoing in my head.

[Pre-Chorus]
Now I'm finally standing tall, preparing for the flight
And suddenly I see it all, this steady, shining light.

[Chorus]
Oh, the sacrifices big and small, the ones I couldn’t see
You put your own dreams on a shelf just so you could raise me
You traded late-night freedom for scraped knees and lullabies
You fought the silent battles with grace and your disguise
A backbone made of steel, a tenderness you kept
You gave up everything you had so I could get some rest
You gave me roots, you gave me wings, you showed me how to grow
And everything I am today, Mom, is everything you sowed.

[Bridge]
I promise I won't waste it, this foundation built on faith
I’ll carry all your lessons, I’ll run my own good race
And maybe one day, Mom, I’ll be half the strength you are
But thank you for the steady hand, and for being my first star.

[Chorus]
Oh, the sacrifices big and small, the ones I couldn’t see
You put your own dreams on a shelf just so you could raise me
You traded late-night freedom for scraped knees and lullabies
You fought the silent battles with grace and your disguise
A backbone made of steel, a tenderness you kept
You gave up everything you had so I could get some rest
You gave me roots, you gave me wings, you showed me how to grow
And everything I am today, Mom, is everything you sowed.

[Outro]
Yeah, everything I am today, Mom...
This steady, shining light.
Thank you.

title: The Steel-Winged Swan
background: I has been bullied a lot as a child, and this song is about the strength and resilience I found in myself to rise above it all, like a steel-winged swan soaring through the storm.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Eight years old, behind the chain-link fence,
Every word a splinter, tearing down my defense.
They left a scar where my confidence should be,
A small, dark secret for the world to see.
I’d hide in the shadows, praying for the end,
A lonely, brittle soul that nobody would defend.
They thought they burned the canvas, thought they stopped the art,
Didn't know the thunder beating in my heart!

[Pre-Chorus]
But that timid girl is gone, she shed her skin tonight!
I’m crawling from the wreckage, stepping into the light!

[Chorus]
I am not the failure! I am the fire!
They tried to drown my soul, but they only fueled the pyre!
Look at the mirror now, yeah, look at what you made!
A steel-winged swan rising from the lonely shade!
The clock is ticking, hear the rhythm of the drum!
I remember you, your judgement day has come!
Packback! Is the promise! Long overdue!

[Verse 2]
Walk these halls again, but I own the ground I tread,
The trembling hands are gone, the quiet voice is dead.
I see their stunned faces, the shock behind the lies,
Trying to place the girl they used to paralyze.
They want a connection, they want to speak my name,
But you don't get a ticket back into my game!
They left the window open, I flew right through the pane,
Now they're standing in the ashes, soaking in the rain!

[Pre-Chorus]
But that timid girl is gone, she shed her skin tonight!
I’m crawling from the wreckage, stepping into the light!

[Chorus]
I am not the failure! I am the fire!
They tried to drown my soul, but they only fueled the pyre!
Look at the mirror now, yeah, look at what you made!
A steel-winged swan rising from the lonely shade!
The clock is ticking, hear the rhythm of the drum!
I remember you, your judgement day has come!
Packback! Is the promise! Long overdue!

[Guitar Solo]

[Bridge]
I won't trade a blow, I won't lower myself to you,
My life's success is all the darkness you are due.
I'm the headline you can't touch, the victory you can't claim,
The perfect satisfaction is to never speak your name!
My silence is the thunder, my walk is the knife,
You are just a memory in the story of my life!
No more fear! I am the storm!

[Chorus]
I am not the failure! I am the fire!
They tried to drown my soul, but they only fueled the pyre!
Look at the mirror now, yeah, look at what you made!
A steel-winged swan rising from the lonely shade!
The clock is ticking, hear the rhythm of the drum!
I remember you, your judgement day has come!
Packback! Is the promise! Long overdue!

[Outro]
Long overdue!
THE SWAN!
THE SWAN!

title: Date Disaster
background: A date where everything that could go wrong, did go wrong. But in the end, it turned into a magical night that I will never forget.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Friday eve, the mirror on the wall
Perfect makeup, ready to give my all
Grabbed my keys, forgot my cashmere coat
A little detail I'll regret tonight, I note
Stepped in the cab, the driver's name was "Jake"
Gave him a twenty, for a five dollar stake
"Keep the change," I slurred, a confident mistake
Now for the ride home, I've got nothing left to take. (Oh no!)

[Chorus]
Ready for a fairytale, got my high heels on
The music's pumping, singing my favorite song
But the universe is laughing, 'cause everything's gone wrong
Still hoping tonight will be where I belong.

[Verse 2]
Stepped out the cab, *rip*, I heard the sound (Damn!)
My stocking tore, a jagged hole was found
Then the sky opened, a torrential, sudden rain (What!)
Soaking my dress, and washing away the pain... (of my perfect face.)
My mascara ran, my eyeliner smudged
Standing there dripping, feeling totally fudged (Spongejul!)
He looked so kind, but my nerves were on the edge
I ordered the lobster, when I wanted the hedge-hog (kidding, but I hated it).

[Chorus]
Ready for a fairytale, got my high heels on
The music's pumping, singing my favorite song
But the universe is laughing, 'cause everything's gone wrong
Still hoping tonight will be where I belong.

[Verse 3]
One glass of wine, two, then three went down fast (Go girl!)
Trying to make the awkward feeling last
Talked about my ex, my cat, and my biggest fear
Slurred every story, whispered in his ear
"I just love this tie!" I probably shouted high
Then dropped my fork, and spilled my drink near my eye
A bright red stain, right down my little black dress
This date's a failure, I truly must confess.

[Bridge]
Tried to stand up straight, felt the room start to spin
Lost my balance, where do I even begin?
He didn't laugh, didn't roll his eyes at me
Just smiled and said, "It's time to set you free."
He walked me to the curb, a proper gentleman
Dialed a taxi, said, "I'll see you again."

[Outro]
I tried to thank him, a clumsy, mumbled word
For rescuing me from the most absurd
And just as I climbed in, beneath the pale street light
He held my face and kissed me goodnight
Suddenly, the stained dress, the tear in my hose
The empty purse, the tipsy prose
All went away, like a bad dream in the haze
He kissed me goodnight, in a dizzy, perfect daze.
Yeah, he kissed me goodnight.

title: Maybe They Knew
background: The first love, the first heartbreak, the first time you realize that love is not always perfect. Our parents may have known this, but we often have to learn it for ourselves.
lyrics:
[Verse 1 ]
Streetlights hit the window pane, you were waiting on the porch
You smelled like gasoline and rain, and my little heart caught fire
Felt like I’d just stepped into a dream, the kind I couldn't write
Every whispered little secret seemed like a perfect, starry night
I didn't need a map or guide, you were all the path I saw
Hand in your hand, nowhere to hide, I was breaking every law.

[Chorus ]
And Mom and Dad said, "Honey, slow down, he's just trouble, you can't see"
"He'll take the best part of this town, then try to change who you could be"
But I just laughed, said, "You don't get it, he's the first real thing I’ve felt"
I ignored the warnings they regretted, the hand I'd been so freely dealt.
I shut the door and turned the key, thinking maybe they just didn't know.

[Verse 2]
He’d show up late, then start a fight, over nothing I had done
He’d dim my friends' and my own light, till I felt I had to run
He’d apologize with flowers bright, and then we’d make up fast
But the silence in the car at night, felt like things wouldn’t last
He said my dreams were a little silly, that my clothes were kinda plain
I traded 'smart' for 'being chilly,' just to keep him from the rain
And I swallowed the lump down in my throat, when my parents called to check
Tried to force a happy note, to keep them safely off my neck.

[Chorus ]
And Mom and Dad said, "Honey, slow down, he's just trouble, you can't see"
"He'll take the best part of this town, then try to change who you could be"
But I just laughed, said, "You don't get it, he's the first real thing I’ve felt"
I ignored the warnings they regretted, the hand I'd been so freely dealt.
I shut the door and turned the key, thinking maybe they just didn't know.

[Bridge]
Then one morning I woke up and stared, at the ceiling where I lay
And I remembered what I cared, and how it'd all been tossed away
I looked at my face in the mirror, and the girl I saw wasn't me
And the truth became much clearer, like a sudden, rushing sea
He didn’t love my spark, he loved the fire that he could tame.
He didn't make me better, just someone he could blame.

[Outro]
I met him at the coffee shop, didn't even take my coat
I didn't let the feeling stop, just let the words climb up my throat
I said, "You don't own the road I walk, and this stop sign is for us"
He didn't fight, he didn't talk, just a silent, angry fuss.
He said, "You'll regret this," as he turned away that day
And a peaceful kind of quiet came, and washed the hurt away.

I went home and stood right there, in the doorway, small and weak
And my mom just ran a hand through my hair, before I even had to speak.
Yeah, I closed the door and dropped the key, and now I finally know:
Maybe they knew. Maybe they knew. And I should have let it go.

title: The Siren's Anchor
background: Women are not always the most vulnerable, but they can be even deadly as a siren. This song is about the power of love to be both a safe harbor and a dangerous trap.
lyrics:
[Verse 1 ]
I spent my life out on the waves, my voice a cruel, magnetic lure,
Singing men into their graves, a life sentence I had to endure.
They called me Siren, called me death, a gorgeous storm they couldn't flee,
And with every final, drowning breath, I only grew more bitterly free.
I knew the pattern of the ruin, the crash against the jagged stone,
But darling, I was never human, until the day I found your own.

[Pre-Chorus ]
You stand there on the lonely shore, just watching me with steady eyes,
You don't demand, you don't implore, you just mirror back the blue skies.
You ask for nothing, hold no chain, only offering a simple hand,
But I remember the fire and the rain, and the shifting, treacherous sand.

[Chorus]
I am the Siren, and you are my Anchor!
The one deep pull that saves me from the sea!
They said true love was a beautiful danger,
But you traded safety just to stand with me!
I can't sing my way back to your arms, I have to swim!
My mythical madness against your gentle core!
Forget the old gods, forget the old charms,
Because my destiny doesn't drown anymore!

[Verse 2 ]
The ocean still whispers names I've known, names I dragged beneath the tide,
They haunt the places where I've grown, but now I have nowhere to hide.
You took the terror from my throat, the darkness from my voice's claim,
You tied my boat to your single note, and gave my violence a new name.
And now I find that strength is quiet, no crashing wave, no desperate flight,
Just simple courage in the riot, of walking into the open light.

[Bridge]
I won't promise you ease, I won't promise you safety or sleep,
My power is built on a terrible lease, on the secrets the wild waters keep.
You ask me to give up the power, for a love that may one day cease,
But I’ll trade eternity in my tower, for just one moment of genuine peace.
You are the one who dares to stay, when everyone else was lost or fled!

[Guitar Solo]

[Chorus]
I am the Siren, and you are my Anchor!
The one deep pull that saves me from the sea!
They said true love was a beautiful danger,
But you traded safety just to stand with me!
I can't sing my way back to your arms, I have to swim!
My mythical madness against your gentle core!
Forget the old gods, forget the old charms,
Because my destiny doesn't drown anymore!

[Outro]
You are my Anchor...
You tied me to the human shore...
I don't drown anymore...

title: The Quiet Kind
background: I prefer the quiet kind, where you can be yourself without the need for constant noise and drama.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The loud world keeps turning, I watch from the side,
I wait for the courage I always must hide.
My heart has a message it struggles to send,
Will I ever find someone on whom I can depend?

[Verse 2]
They move through the crowd with such effortless grace,
I just sip my tea and stare out into space.
I long for connection but silence is my shield,
It's easier to stay in a spot concealed.

[Pre-Chorus]
Another Friday night spent alone on the floor,
Wishing someone would knock quietly on my door.
I whisper a wish to the stars passing by,
That a soul just as lonely will catch my shy eye.

[Chorus]
Oh, I am the Wallflower stuck in the shade,
A promise of springtime that feels like it's delayed.
I don't need a hero or a bold, shining knight,
Just someone who knows how to handle my quiet light.

[Verse 3]
Then there you were sitting, completely alone,
With a book in your lap and a soft, nervous tone.
You didn't look up, you didn't seek the applause,
And I saw in your shyness the mirror of my cause.

[Verse 4]
Your fingers were tracing the lines on the glass,
You look like a moment that passes too fast.
You glanced up and froze when you noticed my stare,
And I saw the same fear and the worry you wear.

[Pre-Chorus]
But the feeling was different, no sudden retreat,
I felt a strange comfort, simple and sweet.
We’re both built of shadows, a whisper, a sigh,
And suddenly the words didn't make me want to cry.

[Chorus]
Oh, we are the Quiet Ones standing in the shade,
The promise of comfort that finally was made.
We don't need a hero or a bold, shining knight,
We both know how to handle the other's quiet light.

[Bridge]
You spoke a soft sentence, I answered with ease,
There was no expectation, just gentle heart's peace.
We fit like two pieces the world left behind,
We're both the soft, gentle, and slow-moving kind.

[Outro]
We'll take our time, there's no need to rush,
We'll build our own rhythm, a soft, loving hush.
We'll figure it out.

title: Sanctified Sinner
background: My duality as a person who is both a sinner rock girl and a saint organist. This is the driving beat I like to play when I want to feel powerful and rebellious.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Sunday morning, sunrise glow.
Hymnal pages, neat in a row.
B-minor key, I know the part.
But there's a wild fire in my heart.
Pew silence before the sermon starts.

[Pre-Chorus] 
Dust motes dance above the aisle.
My fingers glide, a gentle style.
Registers pulled, the sound is deep.
But tonight, the city's calling my sleep.
Gotta save these calluses for something else to keep.

[Chorus]
I'm a Sanctified Sinner in a satin dress, yeah!
Trading high B-flats for a power press.
From the stops and couplers to the fretboard grime,
I make the B3 scream when it's after time!
Gospel groove meets the neon sign.
It's all one frequency, I blur the line!

[Verse 2]
Five nights a week, I'm a different soul.
Black light stage, losing all control.
Bass player's tight, drummer hits the break.
Funk riff drops, the floor starts to shake.
I trade my velvet bench for a synth stack.
No prayers needed when there's no turning back.

[Bridge]
They think the organ is just tradition's sound,
But they don't know the thunder that my low register found.
It's the same nine notes, just a different attack.
Whether it's Bach's Toccata or a funk-rock track.
The power surge when the foot pedals move.
It’s that spiritual lightning, proving what I can prove.

[Chorus] 
I'm a Sanctified Sinner in a satin dress, yeah!
Trading high B-flats for a power press.
From the stops and couplers to the fretboard grime,
I make the B3 scream when it's after time!
Gospel groove meets the neon sign.
It's all one frequency, I blur the line!

[Outro] 
HIT THE STOP SWITCH!
YEAH!

title: Social Lubricant
background: The white lies, the social lubricants that we use to get through the day; a song about the tension between authenticity and social grace.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
She wakes up with a smile that’s perfectly aligned
A calendar of favors she’s leaving behind
“I’m running late—the subway stalled for miles on end”
When the truth is she was just refreshing her feed, my friend.
It’s never malice, never anything too deep
Just tiny secrets that she casually keeps.
A simple 'yes' when she hasn't seen the film
To keep the chatter flowing and her friendship realm

From hitting a dry, awkward, conversational wall.

[Chorus]
Oh, she’s the master of the little white lie,
A social lubricant beneath a bright blue sky.
It’s the oil for the gears of her close-knit clique,
A flawless machine, moving quick and slick.
She pours out falsehoods, never grand or cruel,
Just enough to stay relevant, just enough to be cool.
She calls them "Social Spackle," filling in the gaps,
And nobody ever sees the careful mental traps.

[Verse 2]
"I'm a huge fan of that obscure band you mentioned, too,"
When she's never heard a single track, but knows what to do.
She nods and smiles, remembers who likes what,
Her memory for fiction is her sharpest social cut.
"I totally agree that your new haircut's the best,"
Even if it's lopsided and fails every style test.
A little exaggeration of a weekend’s dull tale,
To give it some flavor so the interest won't fail.

She’s threading needles with a silk of gentle deceit.

[Chorus]
Oh, she’s the master of the little white lie,
A social lubricant beneath a bright blue sky.
It’s the oil for the gears of her close-knit clique,
A flawless machine, moving quick and slick.
She pours out falsehoods, never grand or cruel,
Just enough to stay relevant, just enough to be cool.
She calls them "Social Spackle," filling in the gaps,
And nobody ever sees the careful mental traps.

[Bridge]
Is she lonely? Is she scared the real her is boring?
That without the polish, the conversation's outpouring
Will simply dry up, leaving silence in her wake?
It’s a fragile construction, built for goodness sake.
But the truth is, she's addicted to the easy flow,
The path of least resistance where the social breezes blow.

[Chorus]
Oh, she’s the master of the little white lie,
A social lubricant beneath a bright blue sky.
It’s the oil for the gears of her close-knit clique,
A flawless machine, moving quick and slick.
She pours out falsehoods, never grand or cruel,
Just enough to stay relevant, just enough to be cool.
She calls them "Social Spackle," filling in the gaps,
And nobody ever sees the careful mental traps.

[Outro]
"Oh, I wish I could stay, but I have to leave now,"
A perfect exit line, she gracefully bows.
She walks away alone, checking her phone for the time,
Leaving a wake of flawless, unpolluted, social mime.
The oil keeps flowing...
The oil keeps flowing...
Until the day she trips and the truth starts showing.

title: Cool Fire
background: During my 9 to 5 I am a professional, but when it comes to music I let loose and am a wild fire. This song is about that duality.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
She walks in the room, ice in her veins, a slow-burn stride
Got that leather jacket cool, got nowhere to hide
Talk is low-key, eyes are steady, got a poker face
Moves with a confidence that sets a chill upon this place
You could try to crack the shell, but man, she doesn't budge
Got that stone-cold rhythm, never holding a grudge
Yeah, in the day-to-day, she's the queen of the understated

[Pre-Chorus]
But when the lights drop low and the mic stand's rotated
Something starts to shift, the voltage has been elevated

[Chorus]
Oh, but when the bass line hits and the guitar starts to wail
The cool fire ignites, she's about to derail
That emotion she hides, well, she just can't hold it in
It's a beautiful mess, a raw, glorious spin
She's got the funk-rock soul, she's gonna cry into the beat
From Miss Independent to Queen of the Sweet Defeat!

[Verse 2]
She plugs in the Strat, and the volume starts to climb
Her fingers on the fretboard are forgetting all the time
She belts out a lyric, eyes shut, a tear runs free
That emotion she bottles up is a powerful energy
The crowd is in a trance, watching the transformation
It ain't about technique, it's a pure heart revelation
She's pouring out the pain, the joy, the things you never knew

[Pre-Chorus]
The moment the drummer kicks in with that groove, she's brand new
The cool composure fades, she's electric, wild, and true

[Chorus]
Oh, but when the bass line hits and the guitar starts to wail
The cool fire ignites, she's about to derail
That emotion she hides, well, she just can't hold it in
It's a beautiful mess, a raw, glorious spin
She's got the funk-rock soul, she's gonna cry into the beat
From Miss Independent to Queen of the Sweet Defeat!

[Bridge]
It's a rush, it's a spill, a breakdown in control
The music takes the wheel, it completely grips her soul
She ain't shy on the street, but on the stage, she's a flood
'Cause that funk-rock freedom is running in her blood!

[Chorus]
Oh, but when the bass line hits and the guitar starts to wail
The cool fire ignites, she's about to derail
That emotion she hides, well, she just can't hold it in
It's a beautiful mess, a raw, glorious spin
She's got the funk-rock soul, she's gonna cry into the beat
From Miss Independent to the Queen ...

[Outro]
Yeah, yeah, yeah, the fire, the fire...
She's cool, she's fire...
She leaves it all right there

title: The City I Long For
background: I am fascinated by the history and energy of London, and this song is a love letter to the city that has inspired me in so many ways.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The silver ribbon winds through concrete veins,
Past the ghosts of kings and the rattling trains.
From the red-brick rhythm of a Chelsea street,
To the glass-tower pulse where the bankers meet.
The morning mist wears a heavy crown,
Waking up the giants of this restless town.

[Chorus]
The city I long for, you’re a beautiful mess,
In your Sunday best and your work-day dress.
From the bells of Bow to the Brixton bass,
History is written on your tired face.
You’re the North, the South, and the river between,
The wildest heart that the world has seen.

[Verse 2]
Raindrops dance on a black cab hood,
Doing things that only a local understood.
A thousand tongues in a Camden crowd,
The quiet parks and the pubs too loud.
You can lose yourself in a Soho night,
Then find your soul in the Abbey light.

[Bridge]
The Lions stand guard at the square's cold feet,
While the buskers play for the souls on the street.
Ancient stones beneath the Shard’s sharp eye,
A thousand years reaching for the sky.

[Chorus]
The city I long for, you’re a beautiful mess,
In your Sunday best and your work-day dress.
From the bells of Bow to the Brixton bass,
History is written on your tired face.
You’re the North, the South, and the river between,
The wildest heart that the world has seen.

[Outro]
Mind the gap, let the doors slide wide,
Take the magic in on a rising tide.
Underneath the clouds of a charcoal grey,
City I long for, you’ll lead the way.

title: Peaks of Gold
background: My personal anthem for the olympic winter games, inspired by the beauty of Milan and the Dolomites and the thrill of competition.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
In the shadow of the spires, where the marble meets the sky
A city wakes with burning lungs, watching shadows fly
From the Navigli to the Duomo, there’s a pulse beneath the stone
The grit of every athlete, who has walked this path alone
We’ve traded sleep for silence, and the pavement for the blade
In the fashion of the fearless, this is where the legends fade...
Into the light.

[Chorus 1]
Sotto il cielo di Milano, sulle vette di Cortina
Un solo battito, una fiamma che cammina
Ghiaccio e gloria, il coraggio non ha fine
Siamo l'alba che dipinge le Dolomiti alpine.
Insieme vinceremo, il mondo resterà a guardare
Siamo il vento, siamo il sogno, siamo il mare.

[Verse 2]
Now the valley opens wide, where the "Pale Mountains" rise
The scent of pine and frozen mist, a mirror in our eyes
Carving lines through history, on the powder and the steep
Keeping promises to greatness that we intended to keep
From the speed of the descent to the grace upon the rink
We are standing on the edge, and we refuse to even blink.

[Chorus 1]
Sotto il cielo di Milano, sulle vette di Cortina
Un solo battito, una fiamma che cammina
Ghiaccio e gloria, il coraggio non ha fine
Siamo l'alba che dipinge le Dolomiti alpine.
Insieme vinceremo, il mondo resterà a guardare
Siamo il vento, siamo il sogno, siamo il mare.

[Bridge]
No borders in the blizzard, no limits in the cold
Just the iron in our spirit and the hunger for the gold
From the city’s heart to the mountain’s crest
We’ve come to give the world our best.

[Chorus 2]
L’Italia splende, il ghiaccio si fa fuoco
In questo istante, non è solo un gioco
Dalle città fino alle bianche cime
Scriviamo il sogno che non ha mai fine.
Siamo il traguardo, l'onore e la gloria
Siamo i giganti di questa vittoria.

[Outro]
Milano...
Cortina...
Il coraggio non ha fine.
Siamo noi.

title: Antitoxic
background: A response to social media attacks from those who create nothing; a song about vital energy and positive frequency.
lyrics:
[Intro]
Yeah.
I see the red notifications.
I see the shadows in the comments.
But you know what?
The frequency is changing.

[Verse 1]
You’re typing loud from a silent room
Trying to weave a web of gloom
"Not an artist," yeah, that’s the line
But I don’t see your light shine
I clicked your name, I scrolled the feed
But there’s no harvest, you didn’t sow a seed
An empty channel, a hollow screen
Just a ghost in a digital machine.

[Pre-Chorus]
You’re throwing stones at a glassless house
Quiet as a keyboard, quiet as a mouse
But the rhythm in my chest is beating too fast
To let a little bit of poison ever last.

[Chorus]
My vibe is Antitoxic
I’m breathing in the light, I’m the logic
You can’t pull me down to the basement floor
I’m opening a window, I’m opening a door
It’s vital, it’s golden, it’s alive
I don’t just exist, I arrive
Yeah, my music is the cure, it’s the tonic
Purely Antitoxic.

[Verse 2]
Show me your canvas, show me your soul
Instead of trying to dig me a hole
If you’ve got the vision, then let it out
But all I’m hearing is a muffled shout
I’m building bridges, you’re burning air
I’m making magic, and you’re just there
Comparing my "now" to your "never"
I’m moving forward, I’m clever.

[Guitar solo]

[Bridge]
Energy is currency.
Why spend yours on me?
I’m a forest fire, you’re a spark
I’m the daylight, you’re the dark
But I’m not angry, I’m just free
From the weight of your philosophy.

[Chorus]
My vibe is Antitoxic
I’m breathing in the light, I’m the logic
You can’t pull me down to the basement floor
I’m opening a window, I’m opening a door
It’s vital, it’s golden, it’s alive
I don’t just exist, I arrive
Yeah, my music is the cure, it’s the tonic
Purely Antitoxic.

[Outro]
Keep your shadows, I’ll keep the sun
The song is just beginning, I’ve already won
Empty channels, full heart
This is the life, this is the art.
Antitoxic...
Stay vital.

title: Avalanche
background: A strong relationship where you are deeply involved in emotionally often has the force of an avalanche
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
It started with a hairline fracture
A word you didn't say, a look I couldn't catch
We’ve been living on this incline for a season
Waiting for the gravity to match
The air is getting thin, the sky is turning slate
I feel the shiver in the shelf beneath my feet
They say the silence is the loudest right before
The white-out makes the burial complete.

[Pre-Chorus]
One cold breath, one heavy step
The kind of secrets that we shouldn’t have kept
The pressure's building till the crystals break
How much weight can one heartbeat take?

[Chorus]
And it’s an Avalanche
Coming down to claim the valley of us
Turning every vow we made into dust
You can’t outrun it, you can’t scream for air
It’s beautiful and breathless and it’s everywhere
We’re going under, frozen in the dance
Buried in the hollow of this avalanche.

[Verse 2]
They’ll find us in a thousand years
Locked in this position, static in the blue
I used to fear the cold until I realized
The coldest part of winter was wanting you
There’s a power in the way we fall apart
A kinetic rush that shadows out the sun
Now the house is gone, the map is erased
And there’s nowhere left for us to run.

[Bridge]
It’s not a flood, it’s not a fire
It’s a mountain losing its entire
Weight upon our shoulders, white and blind
Leaving everything we knew behind
Don't fight the slide, don't try to rise
Just look at me with those ice-crag eyes.

[Guitar Solo]

[Chorus]
Yeah, it’s an Avalanche
Coming down to claim the valley of us
Turning every vow we made into dust
You can’t outrun it, you can’t scream for air
It’s beautiful and breathless and it’s everywhere
We’re going under, frozen in the dance
Buried in the hollow of this avalanche.

[Outro]
The snow is settling now...
Everything is quiet.
Everything is white.
Just you and me...
Under the weight.
Under the white.

title: Betrayal
background: When your friend cheats on you it's a painful experience. Try to take it at easy as possible.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
We shared the same coffee, the same morning air
I trusted your shadow, I thought you’d be there
Through the nights I was working, lost in the climb
I thought you were cheering, not just biding your time.
But I saw how you looked in that silk, paper-thin
A dress built for silence, to let the world in
And I saw how he folded, how quickly he fell
For a story so shallow even you couldn't tell.

[Chorus]
I was building a future, you were tearing a seam
You traded a lifetime for a flickering gleam.
It’s a heavy-heart lesson, a bitter-sweet song
To realize the person I loved was just wrong.
You can keep the attention, the glances, the lace
But you’ll never fill up all the emptiness in his face
I’m walking away with my head in the light
Because I’m far too much for a man this slight.

[Verse 2]
I spent my life learning the weight of a thought
While you practiced the angles of things to be bought.
You gave him the glitter, the easy, the brief
And he took it like water, a common-born thief.
I used to think value was something we grew
But he’s looking for mirrors, and he found one in you.
Go on, wear the outfit that says what you lack
I’m finally leaving, and I’m not looking back.

[Bridge]
It’s funny how clearly the patterns emerge
When the lies and the loyalty finally diverge.
I’m not broken or bitter, I’m just seeing the truth
I wasted my wisdom on the ghost of his youth.
He wanted a surface, a flicker, a spark
While I was the fire that held back the dark.

[Chorus]
I was building a future, you were tearing a seam
You traded a lifetime for a flickering gleam.
It’s a heavy-heart lesson, a bitter-sweet song
To realize the person I loved was just wrong.
You can keep the attention, the glances, the lace
But you’ll never fill up all the emptiness in his face
I’m walking away with my head in the light
Because I’m far too much for a man this slight.

[Outro]
I’m packing my mind and I’m clearing the shelf
I’m finally back to just being myself.
I don’t need to fix what was broken so long
His preferences, truly, were always set wrong.
Yeah, they were always set wrong.
Goodbye to the shallow.
Goodbye to you both.

title: Brooklyn
background: An artistic answer to attacks from Brooklyn elitists.
lyrics:
[Intro]
Welcome to the Exhibition.
Please do not touch the artists... they are very fragile.

[Verse 1]
Sitting in the basement, guarding the gate
Talking 'bout the struggle, talking 'bout fate
You got the vintage filter, you got the look
Reading from the same old dusty book
"Analog warmth" just to hide the cold
Selling a story that’s already sold
You think the scratch on the record is "Art"
But it’s just the sound of a stopping heart.

[Pre-Chorus]
You’re scared of the edge, so you round it off
You hear the machine and you start to scoff
But while you were polishing a rusty crown
I built a cathedral in the center of town.

[Chorus]
Welcome to the Museum!
Where nothing ever changes, nothing is new
Just a hollow cage for the chosen few!
You call it "Soul", I call it a grave
You’re not a rebel, you’re just a slave—
To the loop! To the box! To the gallery wall!
I’m the Architect watching the Gentry fall!
WATCH THE GENTRY FALL!

[Verse 2]
Let’s talk power, let’s talk facts
You hide your range in the reverb tracks
You play in circles, safe and slow
That’s why your melody has nowhere to go
You’re terrified of the fire, scared of the shift
Stuck on the ground, missing the lift
You want the "Vibe" but you can’t pay the price
Rolling the same old weighted dice.

[Bridge]
You fought the future.
You fought the code.
And while you were screaming... the Labels reload.
They took your sound.
They bought your street.
Now you’re just a ghost on a corporate beat.

[Guitar Solo]

[Chorus]
Welcome to the Museum!
Where nothing ever changes, nothing is new
Just a hollow cage for the chosen few!
You call it "Soul", I call it a grave
You’re not a rebel, you’re just a slave!
Burn the gallery! Break the wall!
I’m the Architect watching the Gentry fall!

[Outro]
Compare the harvest.
The Museum is closed!

title: Disposable
background: From the "Good Enough" series; an ironic take on flat mainstream music with low-effort melodies.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Lights are low.
Just a guitar now.
This is the part.
Where we try to be real.
We had a fight.
Or maybe we didn't.
It doesn't matter much.
It's just the format.

[Pre-Chorus]
They said make it easy.
They said make it simple.
The melody is slow.
The harmony is sad.
It feels more honest.
When there is no bass.

[Chorus]
Oh-oh-oh. I need you close.
Yeah-yeah-yeah. Let's take it higher.
I need the chorus. It needs to work now.
This is the product. I call it trash.
(I call it trash).
It is disposable. No turning back.

[Verse 2]
Look at the numbers.
The money is rising.
The formula works.
Even when it is quiet.
I'm singing softer.
To sound more vulnerable.
The emotion is faked.
But the reverb is gone.

[Pre-Chorus]
They said make it easy.
They said make it simple.
The melody is slow.
The harmony is sad.
It feels more honest.
When there is no bass.

[Chorus]
Oh-oh-oh. I need you close.
Yeah-yeah-yeah. Let's take it higher.
I need the chorus. It needs to work now.
This is the product. I call it trash.
(I call it trash).
It is disposable. No turning back.

[Bridge]
No big drama.
Just a single tear drop.
This is the part.
Where we feel something small.
Now it is over.
The moment is gone.

[Outro]
Disposable.
It was only for show.

title: Dynamite
background: Capturing the energy and self-consciousness of women who attract attention the moment they enter a room.
lyrics:
[Intro]
Yeah...
Watch out now.
She’s entering the room.
Keep it tight!

[Verse 1]
She don't walk, she glides on the pavement
A neon silhouette in the basement
Got a velvet coat and a gaze like a laser
Looking for trouble? Well, she’s the flavor.
Bartender shaking, spilling the gin
She gives a little wink and the chaos begins
Don’t ask for her number, don’t ask for her name
You’re just a moth flying into the flame!

[Pre-Chorus]
She’s got the rhythm (Uh!)
Locked in her bones
She’s got a heart made of rolling stones!

[Chorus]
She’s a wild one, mamma mia!
Electric shock, pure hysteria
Signorina Dynamite, ready to blow
Spinning round like a disco globe!
She’s a wild one, can’t you see?
A catastrophe in a minor key
Don’t try to tame her, don’t try to fight
You’re gonna dance with the Dynamite
Tonight!

[Verse 2]
She eats danger for breakfast, honey, no lie
She’ll steal your car and wave goodbye
Zero to sixty in a blink of an eye
She’s the funky queen of the Gemini.
Some say she’s crazy, some say she’s free
I say she’s exactly who she wants to be
So clear the floor, give her room to breathe
Before she brings this whole joint to its knees!

[Chorus] She’s a wild one, mamma mia!
Electric shock, pure hysteria
Signorina Dynamite, ready to blow
Spinning round like a disco globe!
She’s a wild one, can’t you see?
A catastrophe in a minor key
Don’t try to tame her, don’t try to fight
You’re gonna dance with the Dynamite
Tonight!

[Bridge]
Ascolta bene, non fare il pazzo
Questa ragazza ti fa il mazzo!
Cammina svelta, tacchi a spillo
Ti mangia vivo wie ein coccodrillo.
È fuoco puro, brucia la pista
La donna più bella sulla tua lista.
Non si ferma mai, no stop, vai!
Sei pronto a perdere? Dimmi, lo sai?
Roma, Milano, Napoli funk
Lei porta il groove wie ein Slam Dunk!
Lasciala andare, è pericolosa
Bella, cattiva, e velenosa!

[Guitar Solo]

[Chorus]
She’s a wild one, mamma mia!
Electric shock, pure hysteria
Signorina Dynamite, ready to blow
Spinning round like a disco globe!
She’s a wild one, can’t you see?
A catastrophe in a minor key
Don’t try to tame her, don’t try to fight
You’re gonna dance with the Dynamite
Tonight!

[Outro]
Dynamite!
Che ragazza!
Don't touch the fuse...
She's gonna blow!
Ciao bella!

title: Embers and Sparks
background: Reflecting on old couples who still hold hands; a meditation on whether love can last 50 years.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
There’s a bench by the oak tree where the sidewalk ends
I watch them sit down like two best friends
He takes a handkerchief out of his vest
Dusts off the wood so her coat doesn't mess
She laughs a sound like dry leaves in the wind
He smiles at a joke that’s deep under his skin
They aren't saying much, they don't need the words
Just watching the people and feeding the birds.

[Pre-Chorus]
And here we are, racing the sun down the street
Burning on adrenaline and skipping a beat
Terrified that silence means something is wrong
Wondering if we’re gonna last quite that long.

[Chorus]
’Cause we are the fireworks, loud and bright
But they are the candle that lasts through the night
We are the hurricane, crashing and fast
They are the shelter built to last
I don’t want a love that just burns out the dark
I want the embers, not just the spark
Oh, baby, look at them, then look at me
That’s who I want us to be.

[Verse 2]
I saw her fixing the collar of his shirt
With hands that have seen all the joy and the hurt
He offered his arm when it was time to go
Moving through molasses, steady and slow
You squeezed my hand tight when we walked on by
Like you were afraid I might float to the sky
But looking at them, I’m learning the truth
That romance is more than just wasted on youth.

[Chorus]
’Cause we are the fireworks, loud and bright
But they are the candle that lasts through the night
We are the hurricane, crashing and fast
They are the shelter built to last
I don’t want a love that just burns out the dark
I want the embers, not just the spark
Oh, baby, look at them, then look at me
That’s who I want us to be.

[Bridge]
It’s not about never getting bored or old
It’s having a hand that you still want to hold
When the skin gets thin and the memories fade
It’s about honoring the mess that you made
Together.

[Instrumental Break]

[Outro]
He opens the car door, she slides inside
Fifty years later, she’s still his bride
I look at you, and I squeeze back tight
I think we can make it through the night.
Yeah, I want the embers...
Not just the spark
Let’s be the embers.

title: Fences Down
background: A plea for the evolution of music and a rebellion against ancestors, celebrating pure vitality and freedom.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I used to live in a house made of glass
Watching the seasons and the polite people pass
Keep the shirt tucked in, keep the heartbeat slow
Walking the lines where they tell you to go
But you crashed in like a gale force wind
Smashing the windows and soaking my skin
Now the roof is gone and the sky is gray
And I wouldn’t have it any other way.

[Pre-Chorus]
Rip up the map, throw the compass in the dirt
I want the adrenaline, I want the hurt
Of feeling something real, something raw like this
A forest fire hidden in a single kiss.

[Chorus]
Let it run wild, let it run deep
It’s a promise that the civilized just can’t keep
We are the wolves at the edge of the town
We are the sound of the fences falling down
It’s untamed, baby, it’s off the chain
Dancing barefoot in the freezing rain
I don’t want the safety, I don’t want the mild
Give me the untamed, give me the wild.

[Verse 2]
They say we’re dangerous, they say we’re a mess
Two loaded guns in a wedding dress
But I’d rather burn out bright and fast
Than sit in the corner and make it last
You taste like copper, you taste like sparks
We’re navigating solely by the darks
No gravity here, just the pull of the blood
Drag me through the river, drag me through the mud.

[Pre-Chorus]
Cut the brakes, let the engine scream
Wake me up from the American dream
I want the friction, I want the bliss
Of a cliff-edge moment just like this.

[Chorus]
Let it run wild, let it run deep
It’s a promise that the civilized just can’t keep
We are the wolves at the edge of the town
We are the sound of the fences falling down
It’s untamed, baby, it’s off the chain
Dancing barefoot in the freezing rain
I don’t want the safety, I don’t want the mild
Give me the untamed, give me the wild.

[Bridge]
Let the neighbors talk
Let the sirens wail
We’re writing our own
Twisted fairy tale
No logic here
No rules apply
Just you and me
And the open sky...
AND THE OPEN SKY!

[Guitar Solo]
[Chorus]
Let it run wild, let it run deep
It’s a promise that the civilized just can’t keep
We are the wolves at the edge of the town
We are the sound of the fences falling down
It’s untamed, baby, it’s off the chain
Dancing barefoot in the freezing rain
I don’t want the safety, I don’t want the mild
Give me the untamed, give me the wild.

[Outro]
Yeah, give me the wild.
Tear the fences down.
Let 'em watch us burn.
Wild.
Untamed.

title: Four Chords Later
background: Part of the "Good Enough" series, mocking the predictable formulas used to maximize streams.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Check the manual. We use the same loop.
It cycles nicely. It always works well.
The key is C minor. Or maybe G flat.
It doesn't matter much. The filter does the job.
Verse one is done now. That took one minute.
The structure is steady. It is predictable.

[Pre-Chorus]
We are still using. The same four chords.
The sequence is simple. It is universally loved.
I change the rhythm. Just a little bit now.
The bass notes shift. Just to pretend.
We are moving forward. We are progressing.
But the foundation. It will not move.

[Chorus]
Four chords later. We have a song here.
Four chords later. The structure is fixed.
Four chords later. We are hitting the charts now.
Four chords later. The feeling is fake.
It saves us time. It saves us money.
It maximizes streams. It is all we need.

[Verse 2]
The boss called me. Said the deadline is tight.
They need the master. By lunch today now.
I cannot change it. I cannot expand.
The complexity is lost. The simplicity sells.
Just add the Auto-Tune. And layer the vocals.
It must sound expensive. But must be quick.

[Pre-Chorus]
We are still using. The same four chords.
The sequence is simple. It is universally loved.
I change the rhythm. Just a little bit now.
The bass notes shift. Just to pretend.
We are moving forward. We are progressing.
But the foundation. It will not move.

[Chorus]
Four chords later. We have a song here.
Four chords later. The structure is fixed.
Four chords later. We are hitting the charts now.
Four chords later. The feeling is fake.
It saves us time. It saves us money.
It maximizes streams. It is all we need.

[Bridge]
Why break the system? If the system works well?
The formula is known. It will not fail us.
The audience accepts it. They embrace the loop.
This is the product. No need to resist.

[Chorus]
Four chords later. We have a song here.
Four chords later. The structure is fixed.
Four chords later. We are hitting the charts now.
Four chords later. The feeling is fake.
It saves us time. It saves us money.
It maximizes streams. It is all we need.

title: Frozen Heart
background: A version of Hans Christian Andersen’s Snow Queen, inspired by the chilling beauty of an ice carving exhibition.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The winter came without a sound
And stole the warmth right from the ground
I saw the splinter in your eye
A jagged piece of a broken sky
You turned away, your blood ran cold
A story that the North Wind told
Now there’s a carriage in the mist
Leading to a kingdom that shouldn't exist.

[Pre-Chorus]
My shoes are worn, my feet are bare
I’m breathing in the silver air
They say the frost will take my mind
But I won't leave your soul behind.

[Chorus]
I’m coming for the heart she froze
Through the stinging white and the heavy snows
She sits upon her throne of glass
Waiting for the years to pass
But she doesn't know what a spark can do
In a world of white and a world of blue
I’ll melt the walls, I’ll break the spell
And bring you back from her winter hell.

[Verse 2]
The Northern Lights begin to dance
Above a silent, crystalline trance
I find you in the Great White Hall
Piecing together a frozen fall
You’re arranging shards of jagged ice
Paying her cold and hollow price
You look at me but you do not see
The ghost of who we used to be.

[Bridge]
It’s not a knife that cuts the gale
It’s not a shield that will prevail
Just a single tear upon your chest
To put the winter king to rest
Can you feel the pulse? Can you feel the beat?
The ice is dying beneath our feet.

[Instrumental Break]

[Chorus]
I’m coming for the heart she froze
Through the stinging white and the heavy snows
She sits upon her throne of glass
Waiting for the years to pass
But she doesn't know what a spark can do
In a world of white and a world of blue
I’ve melted the walls, I’ve broken the spell
We’re leaving now from her winter hell.

[Outro]
The flowers wait beneath the deep
The summer's just been fast asleep
Let the palace crumble, let the crown fall
We’re walking home, past the garden wall...
Past the garden wall.
Home.

title: Garage Band
background: I played the synth. Our bassist was the pastor's daughter, so we were able to rehearse in the church rooms.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Woke up on a Monday, sun in my eyes
Another day in this concrete disguise
Coffee's cold and the rent is due
Got a hole in my jeans and a broken shoe
But there's a hum in my head, a rhythm in my soul
Tonight we'll plug in and lose control

[Chorus]
Three chords, two mics, one beat on the floor
Spilling our guts through the basement door
Amplifier hums and the feedback screams
Chasing down our rock and roll dreams
Sweat and dust and a broken string
Yeah, this is the only song we wanna sing
Just a four-piece band in a rusty old van
Give it all we got, yeah, that's the plan!

[Verse 2]
The neighbor's banging on the wall again
Says we're too loud, "When's it gonna end?"
Tell him to chill, we're making some art
Yeah, this is the sound of a beating heart
My fingers are sore and my throat is raw
Against the odds, defying the law
Of boring jobs and a quiet life
We're cutting through it like a rusty knife

[Chorus]
Three chords, two mics, one beat on the floor
Spilling our guts through the basement door
Amplifier hums and the feedback screams
Chasing down our rock and roll dreams
Sweat and dust and a broken string
Yeah, this is the only song we wanna sing
Just a four-piece band in a rusty old van
Give it all we got, yeah, that's the plan!

[Bridge]
Yeah, the club's a dive and the pay is cheap
But the feeling we get is something deep
A little bit of magic, a little bit of noise
For all the girls and all the boys
Who feel like us, who don't fit in
Let's crank it up and let the show begin!

[Guitar solo]

[Chorus]
Three chords, two mics, one beat on the floor
Spilling our guts through the basement door
Amplifier hums and the feedback screams
Chasing down our rock and roll dreams
Sweat and dust and a broken string
Yeah, this is the only song we wanna sing
Just a four-piece band in a rusty old van
Give it all we got, yeah, that's the plan!

[Outro]
Yeah... the plan...
Just the hum...

title: Good Enough
background: The flagship song of the "Good Enough" series, mimicking the flat, standard vibe of modern radio trash.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Woke up. Sun was bright.
Checked my phone. Felt okay.
I have a feeling. It is mild.
Thinking about stuff. Things I must do.

[Pre-Chorus]
Air is fine. Music plays.
I stand here. No worries now.
It is another day. Everything is fine.
Take a breath. They always say that.

[Chorus]
This is a good moment.
Sky is kind of blue.
I am just moving.
This is okay for me.
We are here. Doing the thing.
It is a standard vibe.
Things are steady now.
Rhythm comes and goes.

[Verse 2]
Saw you. You were near.
You were just standing. You looked neutral.
We looked at each other. We smiled a bit.
We can hang out. Maybe later.

[Pre-Chorus]
Air is fine. Music plays.
I stand here. No worries now.
It is another day. Everything is fine.
Take a breath. They always say that.

[Chorus]
This is a good moment.
Sky is kind of blue.
I am just moving.
This is okay for me.
We are here. Doing the thing.
It is a standard vibe.
Things are steady now.
Rhythm comes and goes.

[Bridge]
No big drama. Flow is smooth.
Where next? I do not know. We will go.
It is simple. Everyone likes this.
This is how things are. This is how I feel.

[Chorus]
This is a good moment.
Sky is kind of blue.
I am just moving.
This is okay for me.
We are here. Doing the thing.
It is a standard vibe.
Things are steady now.
Rhythm comes and goes.

[Outro]
Go. Go.
Good enough.
Fine now.

title: Heart of Fire and Ice
background: A hommage to the Nordic landscape and its duality of warmth and cold.
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The wind bites sharp, a whisper from the polar sea,
Across the midnight sun, where shadows flee.
I stand upon the fjords, carved by ancient ice,
A thousand shades of blue, a chilling paradise.
The moss clings green to stones that the glaciers dropped,
In silent valleys where the world has almost stopped.
A rugged coast that takes the ocean's hardest blow,
Watching the tireless, tidal waters ebb and flow.

[Pre-Chorus]
But beneath the snow and the stone-cold ground,
A fierce and molten heat can still be found.
A promise burning deep, a wild and primal call,
